intro: Rhexia jucunda, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Rhexia jucunda is also notable for its tuberous roots, which give it its common name.
